<TR>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Year ended December 31, 2015 compared to year ended December 31, 2014
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our revenues increased by RMB92.0 million ($14.2 million) or 24.2% from RMB380.2 million in 2014 to RMB472.2 million ($72.9 million) in 2015. The increase was attributed to an increase in sales volume from 4,790,000 units in 2014 to 6,278,000 units in 2015, which resulted in a RMB121.4 million ($18.7 million) increase in revenue. Excluding the sales volume of repurchased inventory that was sold outside of China, our sales volume in 2015 was 3,067,000 units. The increase was partially offset by a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB79.4 in 2014 to RMB75.2 ($11.6) in 2015, which resulted in a RMB29.4 million ($4.5 million) decrease in revenue. The increase was attributed to a decrease in revenue reduction arising from inventory repurchase, under which we bought back RMB391.5 million ($60.4 million) worth of inventory from distributors in 2015, of which provision for estimated sales return of RMB45.4 million and provision for constructive obligation of RMB249.0 million were provided in 2014. The inventory repurchase as reduction in revenue decreased by RMB155.3 million ($24.0 million) from RMB252.4 million in 2014 to RMB97.1 million ($15.0 million). Provision for constructive obligation for the inventory to be repurchased is an offset against our revenues. The increase was also attributed to a decrease in provision for constructive obligation for inventory to be repurchased by RMB141.7 million ($21.9 million) from RMB249.0 million in 2014 to RMB107.3 million ($16.6 million) in 2015. In addition, the increase was attributed to an increase in sales of repurchased inventory by RMB42.8 million ($6.6 million) from RMB68.5 million in 2014 to RMB111.3 million ($17.2 million), the repurchased inventory was adjusted to its net realizable value. In 2015, the sales of RMB111.3 million ($17.2 million) repurchased inventory represented inventory repurchased in 2014 that was sold in January 2015 for RMB45.8 million ($7.1 million) and inventory repurchased in 2015 that was sold for RMB65.5 million ($10.1 million). The increase in revenue was partially offset by a decrease in revenue that excluded the impact of the inventory repurchase and provision for constructive obligation for the inventory to be repurchased. The revenue, net of sales rebates and provision for estimated sales return, decreased by RMB247.8 million ($38.3 million) from RMB813.1 million in 2014 to RMB565.3 million ($87.3 million) in 2015, the decrease was mainly attributed to a decrease in the number of our authorized retail outlets from 898 as of December 31, 2014 to 504 as of December 31, 2015 as well as the softening of China's economic growth and a challenging retail environment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues generated from the sales of our business casual apparel products increased by RMB89.1 million ($13.8 million) or 25.4% from RMB350.5 million in 2014 to RMB439.6 million ($67.9 million) in 2015. This increase was attributed to an increase in sales volume from 4,279,000 units in 2014 to 5,710,000 units in 2015, which resulted in a RMB117.2 million ($18.1 million) increase in revenue. The increase was partially offset by a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB81.9 in 2014 to RMB77.0 ($11.9) in 2015, which resulted in a RMB28.1 million ($4.3 million) decrease in revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues generated from the sales of our business formal apparel products increased by RMB3.4 million ($0.5 million) or 14.7% from RMB23.1 million in 2014 to RMB26.5 million ($4.1 million) in 2015. The increase was attributed to an increase in sales volume from 335,000 units in 2014 to 401,000 units in 2015, which resulted in RMB4.5 million ($0.7 million) increase in revenue. The increase was partially offset by a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB68.9 in 2014 to RMB66.0 ($10.2) in 2015, which resulted in a RMB1.1 million ($0.2 million) decrease in revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues generated from the sales of our accessory products decreased by RMB0.5 million ($0.1 million) or 7.6% from RMB6.6 million in 2014 to RMB6.1 million ($0.9 million) in 2015. The decrease was due to a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB37.5 in 2014 to RMB36.6 ($5.7) in 2015, which resulted in a RMB0.2 million ($0.03 million) decrease in revenue, and a decrease in sales volume from 176,000 units in 2014 to 167,000 units in 2015, which resulted in a RMB0.3 million ($0.05 million) decrease in revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<I>
	Cost of Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our cost of sales increased by RMB309.7 million ($47.8 million) or 71.8% from RMB431.5 million in 2014 to RMB741.2 million ($114.4 million) in 2015. The increase was attributed to a decrease in cost of sales reduction arising from inventory repurchase by RMB180.3 million ($27.8 million) from the net realizable value of RMB114.3 million in 2014 to an additional write down of RMB66.0 million ($10.2 million) in 2015. We bought back RMB391.5 million ($60.4 million) worth of inventory from distributors in 2015 which was written down by RMB315.8 million ($48.8 million) to its net realizable value of RMB75.7 million ($11.7 million), the net realizable value was reduced by provision for estimated sales return of RMB28.9 million ($4.5 million) in 2014 and provision for constructive obligation for inventory to be repurchased of RMB112.8 million ($17.4 million) in 2014 which resulted in additional write down of RMB66.0 million ($10.2 million). The increase was also attributed to a decrease in provision for constructive obligation for inventory to be repurchased by RMB89.8 million ($13.9 million) from RMB112.8 million in 2014 to RMB23.0 million ($3.6 million) in 2015. In addition, the increase was attributed to an increase in the sales of repurchased inventory (which was adjusted to its net realizable value) by RMB42.8 million ($6.6 million) from RMB68.5 million in 2014 to RMB111.3 million ($17.2 million) in 2015. The sales of RMB111.3 million ($17.2 million) repurchased inventory represented inventory repurchased in 2014 that was sold in January 2015 for RMB45.8 million ($7.1 million) and inventory repurchased in 2015 that was sold for RMB65.5 million ($10.1 million). The remaining repurchased inventory in 2015 was carried at its net realizable of value of RMB10.3 million ($1.6 million).
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Selling and Distribution Expenses
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our selling and distribution expenses increased by RMB103.2 million ($15.9 million) or 62.1% from RMB166.2 million in 2014 to RMB269.4 million ($41.6 million) in 2015, primarily due to the fact that the retail network acquisition cost was expensed off. The increase was partially offset by decreases in advertising and promotion expenses, shop rack expenses, packaging expenses and consultancy expenses.
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	In 2015, we acquired the retail network from five distributors in Heilongjiang Province, Fujian Province, Henan Province, Liaoning Province and Anhui Province for RMB164.5 million ($25.4 million). We recorded an intangible asset for RMB14.5 million which represented the estimated fair value of the retail network acquired. The estimated fair value was based on present value analysis on the probability that the expected future economic benefits embodied in the asset will flow to us, the total price paid to acquire the retail network, RMB149.9 million ($23.1 million) was expensed. The retail network consists of 140 authorized retail outlets. Before this acquisition, these authorized retailers did not have direct contractual relationship with us, and were direct customers and had direct contractual relationship with these five distributors. After this acquisition, these distributors ceased their contractual relationship with these authorized retailers and ceased their distributorship in these five provinces. The authorized retailers became direct customers of and have direct contractual relationship with our company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our advertising and promotion expenses decreased by RMB9.2 million ($1.4 million) or 16.2% from RMB56.8 million in 2014 to RMB47.6 million ($7.3 million) in 2015, primarily due to reduction in billboard advertisements across 20 provinces in 2015. These billboards are intended to enhance brand awareness of our products and are specifically targeted at travelers and prospective authorized retailers.
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
	&nbsp;
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE ID="PAGEBREAKBF3E2502-D4FB-4353-A713-D9D0E728DF42" CLASS="PAGEBREAK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD CLASS="HPBHR">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	47
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; LINE-HEIGHT: 0PX">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</P>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our shop rack expenses decreased by RMB29.3 million ($4.5 million) or 36.0% from RMB81.4 million in 2014 to RMB52.1 million ($8.0 million) in 2015. As part of our overall strategy to unify the image of authorized retail outlets, we have been paying for shop rack, signage and various outlet-related accessories for authorized retail outlets opened or refurbished. In 2015, we paid for shop rack, signage and various outlet-related accessories for 127 new retail outlets and refurbished 107 existing retail outlets, including expanding floor space for 25 existing retail outlets. The refurbishment of existing retail outlets is expected to upgrade an outdated brand image, help attract new end consumers and improve the presentation of our products, all in an effort to enhance retail outlet sales in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our packaging expenses decreased by RMB4.6 million ($0.7 million) or 43.4% from RMB10.6 million in 2014 to RMB6.0 million ($0.9 million) in 2015, primarily due to decrease in sales.
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our consultancy expenses decreased by RMB1.4 million ($0.2 million) or 24.6% from RMB5.7 million in 2014 to RMB4.3 million ($0.7 million) in 2015, primarily due to cost cutting initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The percentage of selling and distribution expenses compared to our total revenues increased from 43.7% in 2014 to 57.1% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 90PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Administrative Expenses
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our administrative expenses decreased by RMB5.0 million ($0.8 million) or 16.6% from RMB30.2 million in 2014 to RMB25.2 million ($3.9 million) in 2015 and the percentage of administrative expenses compared to our total revenues increased from 7.9% in 2014 to 5.3% in 2015. Salaries and related costs decreased by RMB4.1 million ($0.6 million) or 25.5% from RMB16.1 million in 2014 to RMB12.0 million ($1.9 million) in 2015, primarily due to the decrease in headcount. Office rental, electricity, office, transportation, telecommunication and other expenses decreased by RMB1.4 million ($0.2 million) or 20.0% from RMB7.0 million in 2014 to RMB5.6 million ($0.9 million) in 2015, primarily due to cost cutting initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Interest and Other Income
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Interest and other income decreased by RMB4.2 million ($0.6 million) or 18.8%, from RMB22.3 million in 2014 to RMB18.1 million ($2.8 million) in 2015, mainly due to lower time deposits placed with banks in 2015 as compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Income Tax Expense/Benefits
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 90PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing factors,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	our loss before taxation increased from RMB225.4 million in 2014 to RMB545.6 million ($84.2 million) in 2015. Accordingly, our income tax benefit decreased by RMB109.6 million ($16.9 million) or 200.0% from income tax benefit of RMB54.8 million in 2014 to income tax expense of RMB54.8 million ($8.5 million), primarily due to the provision for deferred tax allowance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Loss for the Year and Net Margin
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing factors, our net loss increased by RMB429.6 million ($66.3 million) or 251.7% from RMB170.7 million in 2014 to RMB600.3 million ($92.7 million) in 2015. Our net margin increased from a negative of 44.9% in 2014 to a negative 127.1% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Other Comprehensive Income/(Loss)
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Other comprehensive income decreased by RMB1.7 million ($0.3 million) or 242.9% from an exchange gain of RMB0.7 million in 2014 to an exchange loss of RMB1.0 million ($0.2 million) in 2015, mainly due to appreciation of the United States dollar against the Renminbi, which caused the exchange differences on translation of financial statements of entities outside the mainland of the PRC, namely our company and Xiniya Hong Kong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Year ended December 31, 2014 compared to year ended December 31, 2013
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 135PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our revenues decreased by RMB940.7 million or 71.2% from RMB1,320.8&nbsp;million in 2013 to RMB380.2&nbsp;million in 2014. This decrease was attributed to a decrease in sales volume from 5,922,000 units in 2013 to 4,790,000 units in 2014, which resulted in a RMB249.8 million decrease in revenue and a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB223.0 in 2013 to RMB79.4, which resulted in a RMB690.9 million decrease in revenues. The decrease in the sales volume was mainly attributable to a decrease in the number of our authorized retail outlets from 1,583 as of December 31, 2013 to 898 as of December 31, 2014. The decrease in revenues in 2014 was also attributable due to softening of China's economic growth and a challenging retail environment. In addition, the decrease was attributable to repurchased inventory of RMB252.4 million from certain distributors, provision for estimated sales return of RMB45.4 million and provision for constructive obligation of RMB249.0 million for the inventory to be repurchased from distributors. The decrease was partially offset by sales of repurchased inventory of RMB68.5 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues generated from the sales of our business casual apparel products decreased by RMB872.1 million or 71.3% from RMB1,222.6 million in 2013 to RMB350.5 million in 2014. This decrease was primarily due to a decrease in sales volume from 5,265,000 units in 2013 to 4,279,000 units in 2014, which resulted in a RMB228.9 million decrease in revenues and a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB232.2 in 2013 to RMB81.9 in 2014, which resulted in a RMB643.2 million decrease in revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues generated from the sales of our business formal apparel products decreased by RMB54.4 million or 70.2% from RMB77.5 million in 2013 to RMB23.1 million in 2014. The decrease was primarily due to a decrease in sales volume from 419,000 units in 2013 to 335,000 units in 2014, which resulted in a RMB15.5 million decrease in revenues and a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB184.9 in 2013 to RMB68.9 in 2014, which resulted in a RMB38.9 million decrease in revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 90PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Revenues generated from the sales of our accessory products decreased by RMB14.2 million or 68.3% from RMB20.8 million in 2013 to RMB6.6 million in 2014. The decrease was primarily due to a decrease in sales volume from 238,000 units in 2013 to 176,000 units in 2014, which resulted in a RMB5.4 million decrease in revenues and a decrease in average unit selling price from RMB87.4 in 2013 to RMB37.5 in 2014, which resulted in a RMB8.8 million decrease in revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
	&nbsp;
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE ID="PAGEBREAKF393FD50-D2DA-48B2-ABD1-59EBBF791FA8" CLASS="PAGEBREAK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD CLASS="HPBHR">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	48
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; LINE-HEIGHT: 0PX">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</P>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Cost of Sales
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our cost of sales decreased by RMB501.1 million or 53.7% from RMB932.6 million in 2013 to RMB431.5 million in 2014. The decrease was consistent with the decrease in our revenue, which resulted in a decrease in purchases by RMB497.5 million. The decrease in cost of sales was mainly attributable to a decrease in the number of our authorized retail outlets from 1,583 as of December 31, 2013 to 898 as of December 31, 2014 as well as softening of China's economic growth and a challenging retail environment. The decrease was also attributed to the repurchased inventory at its net realizable value of RMB114.3 million as a reduction in cost of sales. In recent years, we observed that the gradual slowdown in China's economy resulted in a slowdown in demand in menswear and, in turn, led to oversupply in the menswear market with excess inventory across the retail network of many menswear companies. In response, we observed that menswear companies began offering discounts and promotions to reduce inventories. Furthermore, we observed that certain menswear companies were repurchasing excess inventory from their distribution and retail network in order to maintain healthy relationships with their distribution and retail partners. In 2014, although we did not have an obligation or arrangement to reacquire excess inventory from distributors, we made a determination that reacquiring excess inventory from certain distributors in 2014 would further strengthen the relationship with our distributors and retail partners. In 2014, we bought back RMB252.4 million of inventory from certain distributors. The repurchased inventory was written down by RMB138.1 million to its net realizable value of RMB114.3 million. This net realizable value was a reduction in cost of sales. In addition, the decrease was attributed to the provision for constructive liability for inventory to be repurchased by RMB112.8 million in 2014. Although none of the distributor agreements contained or contains any right of return provisions or other similar rights, the inventory repurchase initiative implemented in 2014 gives rise to similar expectation from us that we may implement a similar inventory repurchase initiative in subsequent years which, in turn, gives rise to a constructive obligation. A constructive obligation for the inventory to be repurchased was provided by RMB112.8 million in 2014. The decrease was partially offset by the sales of repurchased inventory of RMB68.5 million at its net realizable value outside of China through the Chinese local distribution channel.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Selling and Distribution Expenses
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our selling and distribution expenses decreased by RMB72.7 million or 30.4% from RMB238.9 million in 2013 to RMB166.2 million in 2014, primarily due to decreases in advertising and promotion expenses, shop rack expenses, sales fair expenses, consultancy expenses, training expenses and flagship outlet renovation and rental expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our advertising and promotion expenses decreased by RMB39.9 million or 41.3% from RMB96.7 million in 2013 to RMB56.8 million in 2014, primarily due to reduction in billboard advertisements across 20 provinces in 2014. These billboards are intended to enhance brand awareness of our products and are specifically targeted at travelers and prospective authorized retailers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our shop rack expenses decreased by RMB12.3 million or 13.1% from RMB93.7 million in 2013 to RMB81.4 million in 2014. As part of our overall strategy to unify the image of authorized retail outlets, we have been paying for shop rack, signage and various outlet-related accessories for authorized retail outlets opened or refurbished. In 2014, we paid for shop rack, signage and various outlet-related accessories for 180 new retail outlets and refurbished 169 existing retail outlets, including expanding floor space for 44 existing retail outlets. The refurbishment of existing retail outlets is expected to upgrade an outdated brand image, help attract new end consumers and improve the presentation of our products, all in an effort to enhance retail outlet sales in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We organize two sales fairs a year, usually in April for our fall and winter collections and in September for our spring and summer collections, for our distributors and authorized retailers to attend and place their orders with us. We generated substantially all of our revenue through our two sales fairs. Our sales fair expenses decreased by RMB6.0 million or 83.3% from RMB7.2 million in 2013 to RMB1.2 million in 2014 due mainly to cost cutting initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our consultancy expenses decreased by RMB4.3 million or 43.0% from RMB10.0 million in 2013 to RMB5.7 million in 2014, primarily due to cost cutting initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our training expenses decreased by RMB4.2 million or 56.0% from RMB7.5 million in 2013 to RMB3.3 million in 2014, primarily due to cost cutting initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our flagship outlet renovation and rental expenses decreased by RMB2.5 million or 48.1% from RMB5.2 million in 2013 to RMB2.7 million, primarily due to closure of flagship outlets in Quanzhou City in Fujian Province, Chengdu City in Sichuan Province and Shenyang City in Liaoning Province.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The percentage of selling and distribution expenses compared to our total revenues increased from 18.1% in 2013 to 43.7% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Administrative Expenses
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our administrative expenses decreased by RMB2.4 million or 7.4% from RMB32.6 million in 2013 to RMB30.2 million in 2014 and the percentage of administrative expenses compared to our total revenues increased from 2.5% in 2013 to 7.9% in 2014. Salaries and related costs decreased by RMB1.9 million or 10.6% from RMB18.0 million in 2013 to RMB16.1 million in 2014, primarily due to the decrease in headcount. Other taxes collected by local tax authority decreased by RMB1.0 million or 41.7% from RMB2.4 million in 2013 to RMB1.4 million in 2014, primarily due to reduction in revenues as these taxes are a function of revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Interest and Other Income
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Interest and other income increased by RMB2.8 million or 14.4%, from RMB19.5 million in 2013 to RMB22.3 million in 2014, mainly due to a higher time deposits placed with banks in 2014 as compared to 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Income Tax Expense
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<EM>
</EM>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing factors,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	our profit before taxation decreased from RMB136.2 million in 2013 to a loss before taxation of RMB225.4 million in 2014. Accordingly, our income tax expense decreased by RMB93.8 million or 240.5% from RMB39.0 million in 2013 to an income tax benefit of RMB54.8 million in 2014.
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
	&nbsp;
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE ID="PAGEBREAKF9A94455-5BF6-4109-B268-EF453E54B31C" CLASS="PAGEBREAK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; LINE-HEIGHT: 0PX">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</P>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Loss for the Year and Net Margin
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As a result of the foregoing factors, our net profit decreased by RMB267.9 million or 275.6% from a net profit of RMB97.2 million in 2013 to a net loss of RMB170.7 million in 2014. Our net margin decreased from a positive 7.4% in 2013 to a negative 44.9% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Other Comprehensive Income
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Other comprehensive income decreased by RMB1.7 million or 170.0% from a positive of RMB1.0 million in 2013 to a negative of RMB0.7 million in 2014, mainly due to appreciation of the United States dollar against the Renminbi, which caused the exchange differences on translation of financial statements of entities outside the mainland of the PRC, namely our company and Xiniya Hong Kong.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	B. Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Liquidity
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our independent registered public accounting firm has added an explanatory paragraph to their auditors' report on our December 31, 2015 consolidated financial statements which states certain factors that raise substantial doubt about the Company's ability to continue as a going concern.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our ongoing cash requirements include payments of our employees' salaries and benefits, office and logistics facility rentals, payment to our contract manufacturers and other operational expenses. Our anticipated cash needs also include costs associated with the expansion of our business and our sales force and our working capital requirements. We have financed our operations primarily through capital contributions and cash flows from operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We are a holding company, and conduct substantially all of our business through Fujian Xiniya, our PRC&nbsp;operating subsidiary. We rely on dividends paid by Fujian Xiniya and Xiniya Hong Kong for our cash needs, including the funds necessary to pay dividends and other cash distributions to our shareholders, to service any debt we may incur and to pay our operating expenses. The payment of dividends by entities organized in the PRC&nbsp;is subject to limitations. Current PRC&nbsp;regulations permit our subsidiaries to pay dividends to us only out of their accumulated profits, if any, determined in accordance with PRC&nbsp;accounting standards and regulations. In addition, our operating subsidiary in the PRC&nbsp;is required to set aside a certain amount of its after-tax profits each year, if any, to fund certain statutory reserves. These reserves are not distributable as cash dividends. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, a total of RMB641.8&nbsp;million ($99.1&nbsp;million), including RMB519.2&nbsp;million ($80.2&nbsp;million) of registered capital and RMB122.6&nbsp;million ($18.9&nbsp;million) of statutory reserves, was not available for distribution to us in the form of dividends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The following table sets forth a summary of our cash flows for the periods indicated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our cash and cash equivalents amounted to RMB203.4&nbsp;million ($31.4&nbsp;million). Our cash and cash equivalents consist of cash on hand, cash deposited in banks and time deposit with banks with original maturities of three months or less. We believe that our current levels of cash and cash equivalents, time deposits held at banks and cash flows from operations will be sufficient to meet our anticipated cash needs for at least the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Cash Flow (Used in)/Generated By Operating Activities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our net cash generated by operating activities primarily consists of loss before taxation, as adjusted by depreciation of property, plant and equipment, amortization for intangible assets, provision for estimated sales return, interest income, foreign exchange differences, share-based compensation and changes in assets and liabilities, which include trade receivables, prepayments to suppliers, inventories, other receivables and prepayments, trade payables, deposits received from distributors, other payables and accruals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our net cash used in operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2015 was RMB723.1 million ($111.6 million), which mainly consisted of (i) increase in trade receivables of RMB291.1 million ($44.9 million) primarily due to change in credit policy; (ii) decrease in provision for liability of RMB136.2 million ($21.0 million) due to utilization of such provision arising from inventory repurchase; and (iii) loss before taxation of RMB545.6 million ($84.2 million), as mainly offset by decrease in inventory of RMB83.4 million ($12.9 million) primarily due to sales and the expensing off of the retail network acquisition cost of RMB149.9 million ($23.1 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our net cash generated by operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2014 was RMB113.0 million, which mainly consisted of (i) decrease in trade receivable of RMB301.9 million primarily due to collection from distributors during the year and the inventory repurchase which was offset with the trade receivable; (ii) decrease in prepayments to suppliers of RMB32.6 million primarily due to reduction in orders by distributors; and (iii) a provision for liability of RMB136.2 million arising from constructive obligation of inventory repurchase initiative in 2014, as mainly offset by (i) loss before taxation of RMB225.4 million, (ii) increase in inventory of RMB65.8 million primarily due to inventory repurchase from certain distributors; and (iii) decrease in deposits received from distributors of RMB36.5 million primarily due to reduction in orders by distributors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our net cash used in operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2013 was RMB223.8 million, which mainly consisted of (i) increase in trade receivable of RMB228.3 million primarily due to extended credit terms to distributors; (ii) increase in inventories of RMB21.9 million primarily due to 2014 collections to be delivered in the first quarter of 2014; (iii) decrease in trade payables of RMB65.0 million primarily due to payments to suppliers; and (iv) income tax payments of RMB39.5 million, as mainly offset by profit before taxation of RMB136.2 million.
</FONT>
</P>
	&nbsp;
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE ID="PAGEBREAK9930E565-CAF0-438A-880B-2BDFE951B7A6" CLASS="PAGEBREAK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD CLASS="HPBHR">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	50
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; LINE-HEIGHT: 0PX">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</P>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Cash Flow (Used in)/Generated by Investing Activities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our net cash used in investing activities for the year ended December 31, 2015 was primarily related to the purchase of a retail network of RMB164.5 million ($25.0 million) from five distributors, in part offset by withdrawal of time deposit of RMB70.0 million ($11.0 million) to fund the purchase of a retail network and received of interest from time deposit of RMB28.4 million ($4.0 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our net cash generated by investing activities for the year ended December 31, 2014 was primarily related to decrease in time deposits of RMB60.0 million ($9.7 million) held at banks with maturity over three months and interest received from bank of RMB5.5 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our net cash used in investing activities for the year ended December 31, 2013 was primarily related to increase in time deposits of RMB80.0 million held at banks with maturity over three months, in part offset by the interest received from bank of RMB12.4 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Cash Flow Used in Financing Activities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We did not have financing activities for the year ended December 31, 2013, 2014 and 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Capital Resources
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our capital expenditures, consisting of the purchase of motor vehicles, machinery, leasehold improvements, furniture, fixtures and office equipment, were RMB0.1 million, RMB0.1 million and RMB3.4 million (US$0.5 million) in 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively. Historically, we have financed our operations primarily through cash flows from operations and have not relied on any other sources to finance our operations. We intend to explore other options to finance our operations in the future, including short-term or long-term credit facilities and offerings of debt or equity securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	C. Research and Development
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We have not made, and do not expect to make significant expenditures on research and development. See "Item&nbsp;4. Information on the Company&#8212;B. Business Overview&#8212;Design and Merchandising" and "Item&nbsp;4. Information on the Company&#8212;B. Business Overview&#8212;Intellectual Property Rights."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	D. Trend Information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Other than as disclosed elsewhere in this annual report, we are not aware of any trends, uncertainties, demands, commitments or events for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on our net revenues, income, profitability, liquidity or capital resources, or that would cause the disclosed financial information to be not necessarily indicative of future operating results or financial conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	E. Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We did not have any off-balance sheet commitments or arrangements as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. We have not entered into, nor do we expect to enter into, any off-balance sheet arrangements. We also have not entered into any financial guarantees or other commitments to guarantee the payment obligations of third parties. In addition, we have not entered into any derivative contracts that are indexed to our equity interests and classified as shareholders' equity. Furthermore, we do not have any retained or contingent interest in assets transferred to an unconsolidated entity that serves as credit, liquidity or market risk support to such entity. We do not have any variable interest in any unconsolidated entity that provides financing, liquidity, market risk or credit support to us or that engages in leasing, hedging or research and development services with us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD ID="FFCELL" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	&#8212;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">

</FONT>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Operating lease obligations are mainly related to the lease agreement we entered into with Jinjiang Xiniya for our warehousing facility and a flagship outlet in Jinjiang City, Fujian Province and the lease agreements for our fashion design and sales and marketing facilities in Xiamen City, Fujian Province. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had purchase obligations of RMB153.8&nbsp;million ($23.7&nbsp;million) for purchase orders placed with our contract manufacturers.
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	ITEM&nbsp;6. DIRECTORS, SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<A NAME="FIS_NAME_AND_TITLE"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	A. Directors and Senior Management
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The following table sets forth information regarding our directors and executive officers as of the date of this annual report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE ID="18A6C98E-87AB-4A16-854B-57B0A5B6DB9C" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: AUTO" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">

	Age

	Position/ Title

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Qiming Xu

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">

</FONT>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">

	Chairman and Chief Executive Officer

<TR HEIGHT="15" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	45
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Independent Director
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR HEIGHT="15" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Jianxin Chen
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	66
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Independent Director
</FONT>
</P>

<TR HEIGHT="15" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Chee Jiong Ng
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	46
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Chief Financial Officer
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR HEIGHT="15" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Tiande Liao
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	36
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Chief Designer
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Qiming Xu
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	, age 48, is the founder, chairman of our board of directors and chief executive officer of our company. Mr.&nbsp;Xu has more than 28 years of experience in China's men's apparel industry. He began to manage his family's garment business in 1987 and has engaged in the wholesale men's apparel business since 1993. From February&nbsp;1993 to December&nbsp;2005, Mr.&nbsp;Xu served as general manager and executive director of Shishi Xiniya and was responsible for its overall business development, strategic planning and corporate management. Mr.&nbsp;Xu is also a standing director of the Quanzhou Textile and Garment Chamber of Commerce and a standing director of the Shishi City Hubin District Chamber of Commerce. Mr.&nbsp;Xu completed a diploma program for chief executive officers of enterprises in Senior Business Management at the School of Continuing Education, Tsinghua University. Mr.&nbsp;Xu is a cousin of Mr.&nbsp;Kangkai Zeng.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Kangkai Zeng
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	, age 41, is our director and chief operating officer. Mr.&nbsp;Zeng is also a director of Fujian Xiniya. He has been with our company since August&nbsp;1995 and has worked with Mr.&nbsp;Xu in the men's apparel industry for more than 19 years. His responsibilities include overall business development, strategic planning and corporate management. From July&nbsp;2000 to October&nbsp;2005, Mr.&nbsp;Zeng served as deputy general manager and general manager of Shishi Xiniya and was responsible for the Company's business development and internal corporate management. He completed a diploma program in Advanced Business Management at the School of Continuing Education, Tsinghua University. Mr.&nbsp;Zeng is a cousin of Mr.&nbsp;Qiming Xu.
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Alvin Ang
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	, age 45, has been an independent non-executive director of our company since December 2011. Mr.&nbsp;Ang has served as the group chief financial officer of Cathay Pigments Holdings Limited, a company that has multinational subsidiaries that specialize in iron oxide pigments in the color chemical industry, since August 2007. Mr.&nbsp;Ang has more than 18 years of experience in the accounting profession. Prior to joining Cathay Pigments Holdings Limited, Mr.&nbsp;Ang was an associate director at Stone Forest Consulting, the advisory arm of Singapore public accounting entity RSM Chio Lim LLP, which Mr.&nbsp;Ang joined in January 2006 to help establish its Sarbanes-Oxley compliance division. From December 1996 to January 2006, Mr.&nbsp;Ang worked at PricewaterhouseCoopers Singapore. After the implementation of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, he led teams from PricewaterhouseCoopers on Sarbanes-Oxley attestation assignments for significant subsidiaries of U.S.-listed companies. Mr.&nbsp;Ang received his accountancy qualification from the Chartered Association of Certified Accountants in Singapore in 1996.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mr. Jianxin Chen
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	, age 66, has been an independent non-executive director of our company since June 2014. Mr. Chen is the Executive President of the Fujian Textile Article Association, the Executive Chairman of Fujian Garment &amp; Garment Article Association and the Executive Chairman of Fujian Leather and Synthetic Leather Industry Association. Mr. Chen graduated with a chemistry and chemical engineering degree from Fuzhou University in China.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Chee Jiong Ng
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	, age 46, joined our company as our chief financial officer in June&nbsp;2010. Mr.&nbsp;Ng has more than 19 years of experience in the finance sector and has served in various management roles at several companies before joining our company. He is primarily responsible for overall financial management of our company. Before joining our company, Mr.&nbsp;Ng was a financial consultant in Beijing UGO Ltd. From June&nbsp;2006 to August&nbsp;2009, Mr.&nbsp;Ng served as a senior manager in PricewaterhouseCoopers Beijing. From July&nbsp;2005 to May&nbsp;2006, Mr.&nbsp;Ng worked at AIR-SYS Refrigeration Engineering Technology (Beijing) Co., Ltd. as financial controller. From November&nbsp;1995 to June&nbsp;2005, Mr.&nbsp;Ng worked at PricewaterhouseCoopers Singapore and held several positions, including senior manager. Mr.&nbsp;Ng has been qualified as a Certified Public Accountant of the Australian Society of Certified Public Accountants since 1999. Mr.&nbsp;Ng received his bachelor's degree in Economics from the University of Sydney, Australia and his master's degree in Commerce from the University of New South Wales, Australia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mr. Tiande Liao
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	, age 36, is the Chief Designer and has been with Xiniya since May 2007. Mr. Liao has more than 10 years of experience as a fashion designer and graduated from a professional fashion design school in 2002. From March 2005 to April 2007, Mr. Liao worked at Shishi City Western Regions Weilong Garment Development Co. Ltd. as senior designer and assistant to the Chief Designer. From June 2003 to February 2005, Mr. Liao worked at Xiamen Fuxiang Dress Co., Ltd. as a designer. From July 2002 to May 2003, Mr. Liao worked at Wei Lanxi Garment Development Co., Ltd. as a designer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The business address of each of our directors and executive officers is c/o China Xiniya Fashion Limited,&nbsp;2nd Floor, 90 An Ling Er Road, Xiamen City, Fujian Province 361010, People's Republic of China.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	B. Compensation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Compensation of Directors and Executive Officers
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our directors and executive officers receive compensation in the form of annual salaries and bonuses. While we do not have a specific bonus plan setting the calculation of our annual bonuses, each director and executive officer is entitled to receive an annual discretionary bonus based upon his or her performance of such amount as shall be determined by the board of directors. In addition, we make statutory contributions to a number of social insurance schemes for our executive officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Qiming Xu, our controlling shareholder and chairman, has agreed to grant to each of Mr.&nbsp;Kangkai Zeng, Mr.&nbsp;Chee Jiong Ng and Ms. Meiting Cai certain of our ordinary shares held by him according to a pre-determined schedule of grants. The grant to each of these executive officers represents less than 1% of our outstanding ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	In 2015, the aggregate cash compensation we paid to our directors and executive officers was approximately RMB3.0&nbsp;million ($0.5&nbsp;million), the total social insurance contributions made for our executive officers was approximately RMB167,000 ($26,000). In addition, fees paid to our independent directors were RMB484,000 ($75,000) in 2015. Except as disclosed above, no other compensation or benefits in kind were paid or granted to our executive officers in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
	&nbsp;
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE ID="PAGEBREAK6D1C1BF2-5E47-4245-8F65-99DDA1EF9B48" CLASS="PAGEBREAK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD CLASS="HPBHR">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	52
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; LINE-HEIGHT: 0PX">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage53"></A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</P>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	2010 Equity Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We adopted an equity incentive plan effective upon the completion of our initial public offering. Our 2010 equity incentive plan provides for the grant of options, share appreciation rights, restricted shares, restricted share units, and other share-based awards. The maximum aggregate number of our ordinary shares that may be issued under the 2010 equity incentive plan is 23,200,000. The purpose of the plan is to attract and retain the best available personnel for positions of substantial responsibility, provide additional incentive to employees, directors and consultants and promote the success of our business. Our board of directors believes that our company's long-term success is dependent upon our ability to attract and retain superior individuals who, by virtue of their ability, experience and qualifications, make important contributions to our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Options
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	. The exercise price of incentive stock options must be at least equal to the fair market value of our ordinary shares on the date of grant except pursuant to a transaction under Section&nbsp;424(a) of the Internal Revenue Code. However, the exercise price of all other options may be as determined by the administrator. The term of an incentive stock option may not exceed ten years, except that with respect to any participant who owns 10% of the voting power of all classes of our outstanding shares as of the grant date, the term must not exceed five years and the exercise price must equal at least 110% of the fair market value on the grant date. The administrator of our 2010 equity incentive plan determines the term of all other options. After termination of an employee, director or consultant, he or she may exercise his or her options for the period of time stated in the option agreement. Generally, if termination is due to death or disability, the option will remain exercisable for twelve months. In all other cases, the option will generally remain exercisable for three months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Restricted shares
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	. Restricted share awards are ordinary shares that vest in accordance with terms and conditions established by the administrator and set forth in an award agreement. The administrator will determine the number of restricted shares granted to any employee and may impose whatever conditions to vesting it determines to be appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Share appreciation rights
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	. Share appreciation rights allow the recipient to receive the appreciation in the fair market value of our ordinary shares between the date of grant and the exercise date. The exercise price of share appreciation rights granted under our plan may be as determined by the administrator. Share appreciation rights expire under the same rules that apply to options on the date as determined by the administrator.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Performance units and performance shares
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	. Performance units and performance shares are awards that will result in a payment to a participant only if performance goals established by the administrator are achieved or the awards otherwise vest. The administrator will establish organizational or individual performance goals in its discretion, which, depending on the extent to which they are met, will determine the number and the value of performance units and performance shares to be paid out to participants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Restricted share units
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	. Restricted share units are similar to awards of restricted shares, and are typically settled when the award vests or at some later date if the date of settlement is deferred. Restricted share units may consist of restricted shares, performance shares or performance unit awards, and the administrator may set forth restrictions based on the achievement of specific performance goals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Amendment and termination
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	. Our 2010 equity incentive plan will automatically terminate in 2020, unless we terminate it sooner. Our board of directors has the authority to amend, alter, suspend or terminate the plan provided such action does not impair the rights of any participant with respect to any outstanding awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	C. Board Practices
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Board of Directors
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our board of directors currently consists of four directors. Two independent directors joined the board on December 22, 2011 and June 1, 2014, respectively. Under the New York Stock Exchange Listed Company Manual, or the NYSE Rules, U.S. domestic listed companies are required to have a majority independent board, which is not required under the Companies Law of the Cayman Islands, our home country.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Terms of Directors and Executive Officers
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our directors are not subject to a term of office and will hold office until such times as they resign or are removed from office by ordinary resolutions or as otherwise described below. Mr.&nbsp;Qiming Xu has served as our director since June&nbsp;24, 2010. Mr.&nbsp;Kangkai Zeng has served as our director since October&nbsp;15, 2010. Mr.&nbsp;Alvin Ang has served as our director since December&nbsp;22, 2011. Mr. Jianxin Chen has served as our director since June 1, 2014. Any director can be removed from office by ordinary resolution. A director will be removed from office automatically if, among other things, the director becomes bankrupt or has become of unsound mind. Our officers are appointed by and serve at the discretion of our board of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE ID="PAGEBREAK57DE1C74-52A4-41A0-9F06-4BCACE0607CD" CLASS="PAGEBREAK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD CLASS="HPBHR">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	53
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; LINE-HEIGHT: 0PX">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
</TD>

<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</P>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Committees of the Board of Directors
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We established an audit committee, a compensation committee and a nominating and corporate governance committee upon the completion of our initial public offering. The NYSE Rules require U.S. domestic listed companies to have an audit committee of at least three members, a compensation committee and a nominating/corporate governance committee, each composed entirely of independent directors. These requirements differ from the Companies Law of the Cayman Islands. As described below, our audit committee, compensation committee and our nominating and corporate governance committee are each composed of two members, both of whom are independent directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Audit Committee
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our audit committee consists of Mr.&nbsp;Alvin Ang, and Mr.&nbsp;Jianxin Chen and is chaired by Mr.&nbsp;Ang, a director with accounting and financial management expertise as required by the relevant rules set forth in NYSE Rules. Each of Mr.&nbsp;Ang, and Mr.&nbsp;Chen satisfies the "independence" requirements of Section&nbsp;303A of the NYSE Rules and Rule&nbsp;10A-3 under the Exchange Act. Our board of directors has determined that Mr. Alvin Ang qualifies as "audit committee financial expert" as defined in Item 16A of Form 20-F. The audit committee oversees our accounting and financial reporting processes and the audits of the financial statements of our company. The audit committee is responsible for, among other things:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
</TABLE>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	appointing our independent auditors and pre-approving all auditing and non-auditing services permitted to be performed by our independent auditors;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	reviewing with our independent auditors any audit problems or difficulties and management's response;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;

	&#183;

	reviewing and approving all proposed related party transactions;
</P>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	discussing the annual audited financial statements with management and our independent auditors;
</P>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	reviewing major issues as to the adequacy of our internal controls and any special audit steps adopted in light of our current material weaknesses in internal control;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;

</TD>

	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>

	annually reviewing and reassessing the adequacy of our audit committee charter;

</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	such other matters that are specifically delegated to our audit committee by our board of directors from time to time;
</P>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>

	meeting separately and periodically with management and our internal and independent auditors; and
</P>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

	reporting regularly to the full board of directors.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</FONT>
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</I>

<FONT SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Compensation Committee
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our compensation committee consists of Mr.&nbsp;Alvin Ang and Mr. Jianxin Chen and is chaired by Mr.&nbsp;Ang. Each of Mr. Ang and Mr. Chen satisfies the "independence" requirements of the NYSE Rules. Our compensation committee assists the board in reviewing and approving the compensation structure of our directors and executive officers, including all forms of compensation to be provided to our directors and executive officers. Members of the compensation committee are not prohibited from direct involvement in determining their own compensation. Our chief executive officer may not be present at any committee meeting during which his compensation is deliberated. The compensation committee is responsible for, among other things:
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
</TABLE>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	approving and overseeing the compensation package for our executive officers;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	reviewing and making recommendations to the board with respect to the compensation of our directors;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	reviewing and approving corporate goals and objectives relevant to the compensation of our chief executive officer, evaluating the performance of our chief executive officer in light of those goals and objectives and setting the compensation level of our chief executive officer based on this evaluation; and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	reviewing periodically and making recommendations to the board regarding any long-term incentive compensation or equity plans, programs or similar arrangements, annual bonuses, employee pension and welfare benefit plans.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</FONT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Our nominating and corporate governance committee consists of Mr.&nbsp;Alvin Ang and Mr.&nbsp;Jianxin Chen and is chaired by Mr.&nbsp;Ang. Each of Mr. Ang and Mr. Chen satisfies the "independence" requirements of the NYSE Rules. The nominating and corporate governance committee assists the board of directors in identifying individuals qualified to become our directors and in determining the composition of the board and its committees. The nominating and corporate governance committee is responsible for, among other things:
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 90PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
</TABLE>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	identifying and recommending to the board nominees for election or re-election to the board, or for appointment to fill any vacancy;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	reviewing annually with the board the current composition of the board in light of the characteristics of independence, age, skills, experience and availability of service to us;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	identifying and recommending to the board the directors to serve as members of the board's committees;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	advising the board periodically with respect to significant developments in the law and practice of corporate governance as well as our compliance with applicable laws and regulations and making recommendations to the board on all matters of corporate governance and on any corrective action to be taken; and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="45">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	monitoring compliance with our code of business conduct and ethics, including reviewing the adequacy and effectiveness of our procedures to ensure proper compliance.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<TABLE ID="PAGEBREAKF93DE655-9748-4098-A7C5-B5DDD7C7C570" CLASS="PAGEBREAK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">

<TD CLASS="HPBHR">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	54
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; LINE-HEIGHT: 0PX">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</P>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Interested Transactions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	A director may vote in respect of any contract or transaction in which he or she is interested, provided that the nature of the interest of any directors in such contract or transaction is disclosed by him or her at or prior to its consideration and any vote in that matter, unless he or she is disqualified to vote by the chairman of the relevant board meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Remuneration and Borrowing
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	The directors may determine remuneration to be paid to the directors. The compensation committee will assist the directors in reviewing and approving the compensation structure for the directors. The directors may exercise all the powers of our company to borrow money and to mortgage or charge its undertaking, property and uncalled capital, and to issue debentures or other securities whether outright or as security for any debt obligations of our company or of any third party.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Qualification
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	There is no shareholding qualification for directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Employment Agreements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We have entered into employment agreements with all of our executive officers. Under these agreements, each of our executive officers is employed for a specified time period. We may terminate his or her employment for cause at any time for certain acts of such executive officer, including but not limited to a conviction of a felony, or any gross negligence by the executive officer in connection with the performance of his or her duties that have resulted in material and demonstrable financial harm to us. Upon termination for cause, the executive officer is entitled to the base salary only. We may terminate the employment agreement at any time without cause and upon termination without cause, the employee is generally entitled to a severance payment. An executive officer may resign from our company, in which case such executive officer is generally entitled to his or her base salary only.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Each executive officer has agreed to hold, both during and subsequent to the terms of his or her agreement, in confidence and not to use, except in pursuance of his or her duties in connection with the employment, any of our confidential information, technological secrets, commercial secrets and know-how. Our executive officers have also agreed to disclose to us all inventions, designs and techniques resulted from work performed by them, and to assign us all right, title and interest of such inventions, designs and techniques.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_18"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	D. Employees
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX; TEXT-INDENT: 45PX">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	We had 234, 198 and 140 employees as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively. The following table sets forth by function the number of our employees as of December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE ID="19AEB856-D0C8-426B-B6D2-2728197960FF" STYLE="WIDTH: 85%; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: AUTO" CELLSPACING="0" COLS="5" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="85%" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PX SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2">
	Functions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
